property.name: conf_file
property.description: Config File Template to be used with for mongod instances

property.name: cluster_definition
property.description: This property is used to set up the sharding architecture of the cluster. It also can be used to define which instances are going to be work as arbiters and to set up more than one instance in the same server. For example, the value: "node1,node2,node3/arbiter;node1,node4,node5" will set up a 2 cluster with two shards. The first shard is composed by 3 nodes (1,2 and 3). The 3th node will be an arbiter on the first shard. The second shard is also composed by 3 nodes (1,4 and 5). In the server "node1", two mongod instances will run using different ports. One instance will be in the first shard and the other with participate in the second shard. If this value is empty, just one shard will be created and one instance will be set up for each mongod server in ambari mongodb service install.

property.name: ports
property.description: This port list is separated by commas. You can use a sequence of ports like: 27017-27020. Or complex setting like: 27017,27019,27025-27027. The resulting list of the example will be folling ports: 27017,27019,27025,27026,27027
property.display-name: Avaliable ports for mongod instances on each server

property.name: shard_prefix
property.description: The prefix that will be used to name all the shards. Like: shard0,shard1,...
